page.title: 19Mrs Bandeira
page.content: Mrs Bandeira was born at Guiting Power 87 years ago and married a Portuguese who came to England to cut pit-props during the 1914-18 war. He became manager of the slate quarries at Eyeford. Mrs Bandeira can recall the names and sizes of all the Cotswold slates. The rent of her cottage at Chalk Hill was originally one shilling and sixpence (7.5 pence). Her home now consists of two houses combined into one. There is still no bathroom or W.C. A bath is taken in a tin bath in front of the old black iron grate where the kettles hang to boil. Clothes are washed by hand. Mrs Bandeira does have a T.V. set, and is hoping to have a telephone installed. She enjoys talking about the old days when she helped on the farms, often riding the farm horses at their work.
